page.title: 02THE LERRYN AND FOWEY RIVERS
page.content: The beauty of the{Fowey}river and it's tributary the{Lerryn}attracts people for varied reasons. Many to "mess about in boats" others to watch birds and wildlife, some to just relax and enjoy it's beauty. The river inspires some people to try and capture it's beauty on paper and canvas. It is said that{Kenneth {Grahame}wrote{"The Wind in the {Willows"}after a river trip to Lerryn from Fowey. {Sir Arthur Quiller-Couch}wrote many books set around the Fowey river, in particular "Castle Dor", started in the 1920's, but not finished until 1962 by{Daphne du {Maurier,}another very famous writer about Cornwall. Other writers who have written about the area are{Denis Val-Baker and{Leo Walmsley.
